title: MOOC on Computational Thinking, Programming, and Robotics for Early Childhood and Elementary Educators

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental computer literacy and foundational educational knowledge
context.additional_context: Blended learning model course combining NAU platform online lectures with offline workshops. Strengthens computational thinking, programming, and robotics application competencies in early childhood/elementary education settings

learning_goals: Learners can apply core concepts of computational thinking (decomposition, pattern recognition, abstraction, algorithm design) to early childhood and elementary education activities.
Learners can design simple educational programs using block-based programming tools (such as ScratchJr).
Educators can plan and implement instructional activities utilizing robotics-based teaching aids (e.g., Ozobot, Beebot).
In blended learning environments, teachers can collaborate with peers to develop educational materials and provide feedback.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
